alert.note: Alert for Mellette; Tripp (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Extreme Fire Danger issued April 06 at 2:46AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: .DISCUSSION...It will be mostly cloudy today with very windy conditions and scattered rain or snow showers. Highs will be in the 40s with minimum relative humidity of 50 to 60 percent across northwest SD, and as low as 30 percent across southern SD. Winds will be northwest at 25 to 45 mph with gusts over 60 mph. ...EXTREME FIRE DANGER... The grassland fire danger index will reach the extreme category this afternoon. Extreme weather conditions and very low moisture content of grasses, and other dry organic material on the ground, indicate that critical burning conditions exist. All fires have the potential to become large and spread quickly becoming erratic with extreme behavioral characteristics. No outdoor burning should take place. The outlook for Thursday afternoon, The grassland fire danger index will reach the extreme category.
